value.title: MSIX app attach in Azure portal now generally available

value.title: Digital event: 5 reasons to attend Azure Storage Day
value.excerpt: Join us to discover cloud storage solutions for all of your workloads and learn how to help ensure scalability, security, and compliance with the right Azure storage solution for any use case.

value.title: More performance and choice with new Azure HBv3 virtual machines for HPC
value.excerpt: Today Azure advances the velocity at which we bring the latest technologies to our HPC customers and the compute performance we put at their fingertips.

value.title: Built-in backup management at scale with Backup center
value.excerpt: During this period of the pandemic-disrupted workplace, we have seen unprecedented growth in cloud adoption and dependence on the cloud for data protection to address business continuity and ensure resilience.

value.title: Azure Backup: Operational backup for Azure Blobs is now in public preview
value.excerpt: Operational backup for Azure Blobs gives you a managed data protection solution for block blobs in your storage accounts.

value.title: The Azure Cloud Shell image has been updated
value.excerpt: Azure Cloud Shell has been updated to use a new base image.  This will provide updates to some of the most common tools and commands.

value.title: Azure Backup for SAP HANA backup - User management improvements
value.excerpt: The permissions required by a Azure Backup user for SAP HANA backup is now much simpler and automatically handled by a simple script from Azure Backup.

value.title: Azure Backup support for up to 32 disks is now generally available
value.excerpt: Azure Backup now supports Azure Virtual Machines with up to 32 attached managed disks.Â

value.title: Introducing Azure Backup Center
value.excerpt: Backup Center currently is in public preview for the workloads of Azure Virtual Machines and Azure Database for PostgreSQL servers and limited public preview for the workloads SQL in Azure VMs, SAP HANA in Azure VMs and Azure Files.

value.title: Azure Files SMB Multichannel provides improved performance for clients
value.excerpt: Today, we are announcing the preview of Azure Files SMB Multichannel on premium tier. With this release, Azure Files clients can now take advantage of this technology with premium file shares in the cloud.

value.title: 5 ways to optimize your backup costs with Azure Backup
value.excerpt:

value.title: Monitoring Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes and servers
value.excerpt: Azure Arc is a preview service that enables users to create and attach Kubernetes clusters both inside and outside of Azure. Azure Arc also enables the user to manage Windows and Linux machines outside of Azure the same way native Azure Virtual Machines are managed.

value.title: NFS 3.0 support for Azure Blob storage is now in preview
value.excerpt: To enable customers to run NFS based applications at scale, we are announcing the preview of NFS 3.0 protocol support for Azure Blob storage.

value.title: Run high scale workloads on Blob storage with new 200 TB object sizes
value.excerpt: Azure Blob storage is a massively scalable object storage solution that serves from small amounts to hundreds of petabytes of data per customer across a diverse set of data types including logging, documents, media, genomics, seismic processing, and much more.

value.title: Introducing Azure Load Balancer insights using Azure Monitor for Networks
value.excerpt: Azure Load Balancer customers now have instant access to a preconfigured solution for health monitoring and configuration analysis enabling rapid fault localization and informed design decisions.

images.title: Introducing Azure Load Balancer insights using Azure Monitor for Networks

value.title: Minimize disruption with cost-effective backup and disaster recovery solutions on Azure
value.excerpt: Azure provides native cloud solutions for customers to implement simple, secure and cost-effective business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) strategies for their applications and data whether they are on-premises or on Azure.

value.title: Achieve higher performance and cost savings on Azure with virtual machine bursting
value.excerpt: Virtual machine bursting, which is enabled by default, offers you the ability to achieve higher throughput for a short duration on your virtual machine instance with no additional steps or cost.
